author: rjected
content: why does 4844 use sha256 instead of keccak256 for `kzg_to_versioned_hash`?

author: rjected
content: doesn't matter too much, but I'm curious if there is a reason

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> When specifying the beacon chain, we took the opportunity to swap to sha256 for everything in this new layer to better conform to industry crypto standards for better library reuse, Blockchain interoperability, etc -- rather than keep that layer in the keccak island

Given this is cross layer and *new*, and that sha256 is already in EL clients, we decided to continue on that path
